label: Provide Information Once
description: Ensuring customers only need to give their details or updates a single time, with changes automatically reflected across all relevant services.

label: Faster, Accurate Decisions
description: Bringing together the right information and tools so staff can make quick, well-informed decisions and resolve queries first time.

label: Common Rules Across Products
description: Applying consistent processes and evidence requirements across different benefits, so customers have a simpler, more predictable experience.

label: Better Management of Customer Information
description: Improving how customer data is collected, stored, and shared, so records are always accurate, up to date, and easy to access for those who need them.

label: Easier to Track Progress of a Claim
description: Giving customers clear, real-time updates on their claims and applications, reducing the need for follow-up calls or letters.

label: More Time for Customers Who Need Extra Support
description: Using automation and digital tools to free up staff time, so more help can be given to those with complex or additional needs.

label: Simpler Instructions and Guidance
description: Making processes and communications straightforward and easy to understand, so customers can complete tasks confidently.

label: Skilled to Use Digital Tools
description: Ensuring staff have the training and support needed to use new technology effectively and deliver high-quality digital services.

label: No Need to Move Between Systems
description: Integrating systems and data so staff and customers can complete tasks without switching between multiple platforms.

label: Accurate Payments
description: Designing services and checks to ensure customers receive the right payments at the right time, reducing mistakes and overpayments.

label: Right First Time
description: Focusing on getting things correct from the start, so customers don't need to chase up or correct errors later.

label: Improved Verification of Customer Information
description: Strengthening identity and evidence checks to prevent fraud and ensure only eligible people receive support.

label: Remove Potential for Fraud and Error at the Beginning of a Claim
description: Building in safeguards and checks at the start of the process to stop problems before they happen.

label: Capability to Move Roles to Meet Demand/Reduce Backlogs
description: Using flexible systems and workforce planning to quickly respond to changing workloads and keep services running smoothly.

label: 24/7 Self-Service, with Human Support Where Needed
description: Offering customers the ability to access services online at any time, with the option of speaking to a person when extra help is needed.

label: Consistent Experience Across Channels and Services
description: Ensuring customers get the same high-quality service and information, whether they use digital, phone, or face-to-face channels.

label: Easier Access to Services
description: Making it simple for customers to find, start, and complete the services they need, regardless of their preferred channel.

label: Customers Automatically Routed to the Right Colleague
description: Using technology to direct customers to the most appropriate staff member or team, reducing wait times and handoffs.

label: More Tailored Support
description: Working with local partners to provide services that are personalised to the needs of different communities and individuals.

label: Support for Those Looking for Work or Wanting to Progress
description: Helping people access the right support, training, and opportunities to find work or advance their careers.

label: Make Use of Local Expertise
description: Drawing on the knowledge and resources of local organisations to improve service delivery and outcomes.

label: Local Communities Delivering Together
description: Collaborating with local authorities and community groups to deliver joined-up support for customers.

label: Innovative Ways to Deliver Services Where Customers Are
description: Testing and adopting new approaches to reach and support customers in the places and ways that work best for them.

label: Face-to-Face Services Where They Add Value
description: Providing in-person support for customers who need it, while encouraging digital and remote options where appropriate.

label: Accessible, Inclusive Locations
description: Ensuring DWP sites and services are easy to reach and use for everyone, including those with additional needs.

label: Services Designed and Delivered Sustainably
description: Building and running services in ways that reduce environmental impact and make the best use of resources.

label: Sustainability Informs Everyday Decisions
description: Embedding environmental and social responsibility into daily operations and decision-making.

label: Workspaces Designed for Multi-Channel Services
description: Equipping staff and offices with the tools and technology needed to deliver services across digital, phone, and in-person channels.
